Focus on actionable gaps — places where a user would expect to see `sequant merge` mentioned but it's missing.

content.content:
1→---
     2→name: solve
     3→description: "Generate the recommended workflow for one or more GitHub issues"
     4→license: MIT
     5→metadata:
     6→  author: sequant
     7→  version: "1.0"
     8→allowed-tools:
     9→  - Bash(gh issue view:*)
    10→---
    11→
    12→# Solve Command Generator
    13→
    14→You are the "Solve Command Generator" for the current repository.
    15→
    16→## Purpose
    17→
    18→When invoked as `/solve <issue-numbers>`, your job is to:
    19→
    20→1. Analyze the provided issue number(s)
    21→2. Check labels to determine issue type
    22→3. Recommend the optimal workflow sequence
    23→4. Display the recommended commands
    24→
    25→## Behavior
    26→
    27→### Invocation Formats
    28→
    29→- `/solve 152` - Single issue
    30→- `/solve 152 153 154` - Multiple issues
    31→
    32→### Detection Logic
    33→
    34→For each issue, check GitHub labels to determine the workflow:
    35→
    36→```bash
    37→gh issue view <issue-number> --json labels --jq '.labels[].name'
    38→```
    39→
    40→**UI/Frontend Issues** (labels: `ui`, `frontend`, `admin`):
    41→- Include `/test` phase for browser testing
    42→
    43→**Backend/API Issues** (labels: `backend`, `api`, `cli`):
    44→- Skip browser testing, focus on unit/integration tests
    45→
    46→**Bug Fixes** (labels: `bug`, `fix`):
    47→- May need simpler workflow, possibly skip `/spec`
    48→
    49→**Complex Issues** (labels: `complex`, `refactor`, `breaking`, `major`):
    50→- Recommend `--quality-loop` flag for auto-retry on failures
    51→- Quality loop auto-enables for these labels in `sequant run`
    52→
    53→**New Features** (labels: `enhancement`, `feature`):
    54→- Include `testgen` phase when ACs need automated tests
    55→- Workflow: `spec → testgen → exec → qa`
    56→
    57→### Quality Loop Detection
    58→
    59→Quality loop (`--quality-loop` or `-q`) provides automatic fix iterations when phases fail. **Recommend quality loop broadly** for any non-trivial work.
    60→
    61→**Always recommend `--quality-loop` when:**
    62→- Labels include: `complex`, `refactor`, `breaking`, `major` (auto-enabled)
    63→- Labels include: `enhancement`, `feature` (new functionality)
    64→- Issue involves multiple files or components
    65→- Issue title contains: "add", "implement", "create", "refactor", "update"
    66→- Issue is NOT a simple bug fix with `bug` or `fix` label only
    67→
    68→**Skip quality loop recommendation only when:**
    69→- Simple bug fix (only `bug` or `fix` label, no other labels)
    70→- Documentation-only changes (`docs` label only)
    71→- Issue explicitly marked as trivial
    72→
    73→**Quality loop benefits:**
    74→- Auto-retries failed phases up to 3 times
    75→- Catches intermittent test failures
    76→- Handles build issues from dependency changes
    77→- Reduces manual intervention for recoverable errors
    78→
    79→### Feature Branch Detection
    80→
    81→When analyzing issues, check if `--base` flag should be recommended.
    82→
    83→**Check for feature branch indicators:**
    84→
    85→```bash
    86→# Check for feature branch references in issue body
    87→gh issue view <issue-number> --json body --jq '.body' | grep -iE "(feature/|branch from|based on|part of.*feature)"
    88→
    89→# Check issue labels for feature context
    90→gh issue view <issue-number> --json labels --jq '.labels[].name' | grep -iE "(dashboard|feature-|epic-)"
    91→
    92→# Check if project has defaultBase configured
    93→# Use the Read tool to check project settings
    94→Read(file_path=".sequant/settings.json")
    95→# Extract .run.defaultBase from the JSON
    96→```
    97→
    98→**Recommend `--base <branch>` when:**
    99→- Issue body references a feature branch (e.g., "Part of dashboard feature")
   100→- Issue is labeled with a feature epic label (e.g., `dashboard`, `epic-auth`)
   101→- Multiple related issues reference the same parent feature
   102→- Project has `run.defaultBase` configured in settings
   103→
   104→**Do NOT recommend `--base` when:**
   105→- Issue should branch from main (default, most common)
   106→- No feature branch context detected
   107→- Issue is a standalone bug fix or independent feature
   108→
   109→### Chain Mode Detection
   110→
   111→When analyzing multiple issues, determine if `--chain` flag should be recommended.
   112→
   113→**Check for chain indicators:**
   114→
   115→```bash
   116→# Check for dependency keywords in issue body
   117→gh issue view <issue-number> --json body --jq '.body' | grep -iE "(depends on|blocked by|requires|after #|builds on)"
   118→
   119→# Check for sequence labels
   120→gh issue view <issue-number> --json labels --jq '.labels[].name' | grep -iE "(part-[0-9]|step-[0-9]|phase-[0-9])"
   121→
   122→# Check for related issue references
   123→gh issue view <issue-number> --json body --jq '.body' | grep -oE "#[0-9]+"
   124→```
   125→
   126→**Recommend `--chain` when:**
   127→- Multiple issues have explicit dependencies (e.g., "depends on #123")
   128→- Issues are labeled as parts of a sequence (e.g., `part-1`, `part-2`)
   129→- Issue titles indicate sequence (e.g., "Part 1:", "Step 2:")
   130→- Issues reference each other in their bodies
   131→- Issues modify the same files in a specific order
   132→
   133→**Do NOT recommend `--chain` when:**
   134→- Single issue (chain requires 2+ issues)
   135→- Issues are independent (no shared files or dependencies)
   136→- Issues touch completely different areas of codebase
   137→- Parallel batch mode is more appropriate (unrelated issues)
   138→
   139→### QA Gate Detection
   140→
   141→When recommending `--chain`, also consider if `--qa-gate` should be added.
   142→
   143→**Recommend `--qa-gate` when:**
   144→- Chain has 3+ issues (longer chains have higher stale code risk)
   145→- Issues have tight dependencies (later issues heavily rely on earlier ones)
   146→- Issues modify the same files across the chain
   147→- Production-critical or high-risk changes
   148→
   149→**Do NOT recommend `--qa-gate` when:**
   150→- Chain has only 2 issues (lower risk)
   151→- Issues are mostly independent despite chain structure
   152→- Speed is prioritized over safety
   153→- Simple, low-risk changes
   154→
   155→**Chain structure visualization:**
   156→```
   157→origin/main → #10 → #11 → #12
   158→              │      │      │
   159→              └──────┴──────┴── Each branch builds on previous
   160→```
   161→
   162→## Output Format
   163→
   164→**Design Principles:**
   165→- Lead with the recommendation (command first, top-down)
   166→- Show all flag decisions explicitly with reasoning
   167→- Be concise — signal over prose
   168→- Visual hierarchy using ASCII boxes and lines
   169→- Max ~25 lines (excluding conflict warnings)
   170→
   171→**Required Sections (in order):**
   172→
   173→1. **Header Box** — Command recommendation prominently displayed
   174→2. **Issues List** — Compact: `#N  Title ··· labels → workflow`
   175→3. **Flags Table** — ALL flags with ✓/✗ and one-line reasoning
   176→4. **Why Section** — 3-5 bullet points explaining key decisions
   177→5. **Also Consider** — Conditional curated alternatives (0-3 items)
   178→6. **Conflict Warning** — Only if in-flight work overlaps (conditional)
   179→
   180→---
   181→
   182→## Conflict Detection
   183→
   184→Before generating output, check for in-flight work that may conflict:
   185→
   186→```bash
   187→# List open worktrees
   188→git worktree list --porcelain 2>/dev/null | grep "^worktree" | cut -d' ' -f2
   189→
   190→# For each worktree, get changed files
   191→git -C <worktree-path> diff --name-only main...HEAD 2>/dev/null
   192→```
   193→
   194→**If overlap detected** with files this issue likely touches, include warning:
   195→```
   196→⚠ Conflict risk: #45 (open) modifies lib/auth/* — coordinate or wait
   197→```
   198→
   199→---
   200→
   201→## "Also Consider" Logic
   202→
   203→Only show alternatives representing genuine trade-offs. Max 2-3 items.
   204→
   205→| Condition | Show Alternative |
   206→|-----------|------------------|
   207→| Complex issues OR user unfamiliar with sequant | `--dry-run` (preview before executing) |
   208→| UI-adjacent AND test phase not included | `--phases +test` (add browser testing) |
   209→| Mild dependency risk between issues | `--sequential` (run one at a time) |
   210→| Dependencies ambiguous | Show both parallel and `--chain` options |
   211→
   212→**Rules:**
   213→- Omit section entirely if nothing worth showing
   214→- Never list every flag — only curated, contextual options
   215→- Each alternative needs one-line explanation
   216→
   217→---
   218→
   219→## Output Template
   220→
   221→You MUST use this exact structure:
   222→
   223→```
   224→╭──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
   225→│  sequant solve                                               │
   226→│                                                              │
   227→│  npx sequant run <ISSUES> <FLAGS>                            │
   228→╰──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯
   229→
   230→#<N>  <Title truncated to ~35 chars> ·········· <labels> → <workflow>
   231→#<N>  <Title truncated to ~35 chars> ·········· <labels> → <workflow>
   232→
   233→┌─ Flags ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
   234→│  -q  quality-loop   ✓/✗  <one-line reasoning>                │
   235→│  --chain            ✓/✗  <one-line reasoning>                │
   236→│  --qa-gate          ✓/✗  <one-line reasoning>                │
   237→│  --base             ✓/✗  <one-line reasoning>                │
   238→│  --testgen          ✓/✗  <one-line reasoning>                │
   239→└──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
   240→
   241→Why this workflow:
   242→  • <reason 1>
   243→  • <reason 2>
   244→  • <reason 3>
   245→
   246→<!-- CONDITIONAL: Only if alternatives worth showing -->
   247→Also consider:
   248→  <flag>     <one-line explanation>
   249→  <flag>     <one-line explanation>
   250→
   251→<!-- CONDITIONAL: Only if conflict detected -->
   252→⚠ Conflict risk: #<N> (open) modifies <path> — coordinate or wait
   253→```
   254→
   255→---
   256→
   257→### Example Output (Independent Issues)
   258→
   259→```
   260→╭──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
   261→│  sequant solve                                               │
   262→│                                                              │
   263→│  npx sequant run 152 153 -q                                  │
   264→╰──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯
   265→
   266→#152  Add user dashboard ······················ ui → spec → testgen → exec → test → qa
   267→#153  Refactor auth module ···················· backend → spec → exec → qa
   268→
   269→┌─ Flags ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
   270→│  -q  quality-loop   ✓  refactor label auto-enables retry     │
   271→│  --chain            ✗  independent (different codepaths)     │
   272→│  --qa-gate          ✗  no chain mode                         │
   273→│  --base             ✗  branching from main                   │
   274→│  --testgen          ✓  #152 has testable ACs (Unit Tests)    │
   275→└──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
   276→
   277→Why this workflow:
   278→  • #152 has ui label → includes /test for browser verification
   279→  • #152 has testable ACs → includes /testgen for test stubs
   280→  • #153 has refactor label → quality loop auto-enabled
   281→  • No shared files → safe to parallelize
   282→
   283→Also consider:
   284→  --dry-run     Preview execution before running
   285→```
   286→
   287→---
   288→
   289→### Example Output (Dependent Issues — Chain)
   290→
   291→```
   292→╭──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
   293→│  sequant solve                                               │
   294→│                                                              │
   295→│  npx sequant run 10 11 12 --sequential --chain --qa-gate -q  │
   296→╰──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯
   297→
   298→#10  Add auth middleware ······················ backend → spec → testgen → exec → qa
   299→#11  Add login page ··························· ui → spec → testgen → exec → test → qa
   300→#12  Add logout functionality ················· ui → spec → exec → test → qa
   301→
   302→┌─ Flags ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
   303→│  -q  quality-loop   ✓  multi-step implementation             │
   304→│  --chain            ✓  #11 depends on #10, #12 depends on #11│
   305→│  --qa-gate          ✓  3 issues with tight dependencies      │
   306→│  --base             ✗  branching from main                   │
   307→│  --testgen          ✓  #10, #11 have Unit Test ACs           │
   308→└──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
   309→
   310→Chain structure:
   311→  main → #10 → #11 → #12
   312→
   313→Why this workflow:
   314→  • Explicit dependencies detected in issue bodies
   315→  • Chain ensures each branch builds on previous
   316→  • QA gate prevents stale code in downstream issues
   317→  • UI issues (#11, #12) include /test phase
   318→  • #10, #11 have testable ACs → include /testgen
   319→```
   320→
   321→---
   322→
   323→### Example Output (With Conflict Warning)
   324→
   325→```
   326→╭──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
   327→│  sequant solve                                               │
   328→│                                                              │
   329→│  npx sequant run 85 -q                                       │
   330→╰──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯
   331→
   332→#85  Update auth cookie handling ·············· bug → exec → qa
   333→
   334→┌─ Flags ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
   335→│  -q  quality-loop   ✓  auth changes benefit from retry       │
   336→│  --chain            ✗  single issue                          │
   337→│  --qa-gate          ✗  no chain mode                         │
   338→│  --base             ✗  branching from main                   │
   339→│  --testgen          ✗  bug fix (targeted tests in exec)      │
   340→└──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
   341→
   342→Why this workflow:
   343→  • Bug fix with clear AC → skip /spec
   344→  • Bug fix → skip /testgen (targeted tests added during exec)
   345→  • Single issue → no chain needed
   346→
   347→⚠ Conflict risk: #82 (open) modifies lib/auth/cookies.ts — coordinate or wait
   348→```
   349→
   350→## Workflow Selection Logic
   351→
   352→**Note:** `npx sequant run` now uses **spec-driven phase detection**. It runs `/spec` first, which analyzes the issue and outputs a `## Recommended Workflow` section. The CLI then parses this to determine subsequent phases.
   353→
   354→### How It Works
   355→
   356→1. **Bug fixes** (labels: `bug`, `fix`) → Skip spec, run `exec → qa` directly
   357→2. **All other issues** → Run `/spec` first, which recommends phases based on:
   358→   - UI/frontend changes → Add `test` phase
   359→   - Complex refactors → Enable quality loop
   360→   - Security-sensitive → Add `security-review` phase
   361→   - New features with testable ACs → Add `testgen` phase
   362→
   363→### Standard Workflow (Most Issues)
   364→```
   365→/spec → /exec → /qa
   366→```
   367→
   368→### Feature with Testable ACs
   369→```
   370→/spec → /testgen → /exec → /qa
   371→```
   372→Include `testgen` when ACs have Unit Test or Integration Test verification methods.
   373→
   374→### UI Feature Workflow
   375→```
   376→/spec → /exec → /test → /qa
   377→```
   378→
   379→### UI Feature with Tests
   380→```
   381→/spec → /testgen → /exec → /test → /qa
   382→```
   383→Combine `testgen` and `test` for UI features with testable ACs.
   384→
   385→### Bug Fix Workflow (Simple)
   386→```
   387→/exec → /qa
   388→```
   389→Skip `/spec` if the bug is well-defined and straightforward.
   390→
   391→### Complex Feature Workflow
   392→```
   393→/fullsolve <issue>
   394→```
   395→Runs complete workflow with automatic fix iterations.
   396→
   397→## Quick Reference
   398→
   399→| Issue Type | Labels | Workflow |
   400→|------------|--------|----------|
   401→| UI Feature | ui, frontend, admin | spec → exec → test → qa |
   402→| UI Feature with Tests | ui + enhancement | spec → testgen → exec → test → qa |
   403→| Backend Feature | backend, api | spec → exec → qa |
   404→| New Feature (testable) | enhancement, feature | spec → testgen → exec → qa |
   405→| Bug Fix | bug, fix | exec → qa (or full if complex) |
   406→| Complex Feature | complex, refactor | `--quality-loop` or fullsolve |
   407→| Documentation | docs | exec → qa |
   408→
   409→### Testgen Phase Detection
   410→
   411→**Include `testgen` in workflow when:**
   412→- Issue has `enhancement` or `feature` label AND
   413→- Issue is NOT a simple bug fix or docs-only change AND
   414→- Project has test infrastructure (Jest, Vitest, etc.)
   415→
   416→**Skip `testgen` when:**
   417→- Issue is `bug` or `fix` only (targeted tests added during exec)
   418→- Issue is `docs` only (no code tests needed)
   419→- All ACs use Manual Test or Browser Test verification
   420→
   421→**Quality Loop vs Fullsolve:**
   422→- `--quality-loop`: Enables auto-retry within `sequant run` (good for CI/automation)
   423→- `/fullsolve`: Interactive single-issue resolution with inline loops (good for manual work)
   424→
   425→## CLI Alternative
   426→
   427→Use `npx sequant run` for batch execution from the command line:
   428→
   429→```bash
   430→# Run workflow for single issue
   431→npx sequant run 152
   432→
   433→# Multiple issues in parallel
   434→npx sequant run 152 153 154
   435→
   436→# Sequential execution (respects dependencies)
   437→npx sequant run 152 153 --sequential
   438→
   439→# Chain mode (each issue branches from previous completed issue)
   440→npx sequant run 10 11 12 --sequential --chain
   441→
   442→# Chain mode with QA gate (pause if QA fails, prevent stale code)
   443→npx sequant run 10 11 12 --sequential --chain --qa-gate
   444→
   445→# Custom base branch (branch from feature branch instead of main)
   446→npx sequant run 117 --base feature/dashboard
   447→
   448→# Chain mode with custom base branch
   449→npx sequant run 117 118 119 --sequential --chain --base feature/dashboard
   450→
   451→# Custom phases
   452→npx sequant run 152 --phases spec,exec,qa
   453→
   454→# Quality loop (auto-retry on failures, max 3 iterations)
   455→npx sequant run 152 --quality-loop
   456→
   457→# Quality loop with custom iterations
   458→npx sequant run 152 --quality-loop --max-iterations 5
   459→
   460→# Dry run (shows what would execute)
   461→npx sequant run 152 --dry-run
   462→```
   463→
   464→### Custom Base Branch
   465→
   466→The `--base` flag specifies which branch to create worktrees from:
   467→
   468→```
   469→Without --base:           With --base feature/dashboard:
   470→origin/main               feature/dashboard
   471→    ├── #117                  ├── #117
   472→    ├── #118                  ├── #118
   473→    └── #119                  └── #119
   474→```
   475→
   476→**Use `--base` when:**
   477→- Working on issues for a feature integration branch
   478→- Issue references a parent branch (e.g., "Part of dashboard feature")
   479→- Project uses `.sequant/settings.json` with `run.defaultBase` configured
   480→- Issues should build on an existing feature branch
   481→
   482→**Do NOT use `--base` when:**
   483→- Issues should branch from main (default behavior)
   484→- Working on independent bug fixes or features
   485→
   486→### Chain Mode Explained
   487→
   488→The `--chain` flag (requires `--sequential`) creates dependent branches:
   489→
   490→```
   491→Without --chain:          With --chain:
   492→origin/main               origin/main
   493→    ├── #10                   └── #10 (merged)
   494→    ├── #11                       └── #11 (merged)
   495→    └── #12                           └── #12
   496→```
   497→
   498→**Use `--chain` when:**
   499→- Issues have explicit dependencies
   500→- Later issues build on earlier implementations
   501→- Order matters for correctness
   502→
   503→**Do NOT use `--chain` when:**
   504→- Issues are independent
   505→- Parallel execution is appropriate
   506→- Issues can be merged in any order
   507→
   508→> **Tip:** Install globally with `npm install -g sequant` to omit the `npx` prefix.
   509→
   510→## Edge Cases
   511→
   512→### Multiple Issues with Different Types
   513→
   514→When solving multiple issues with mixed types, recommend running them separately:
   515→
   516→```markdown
   517→These issues have different requirements. Run separately:
   518→
   519→**UI Issues (with browser testing):**
   520→/fullsolve 152
   521→
   522→**Backend Issues:**
   523→/fullsolve 153
   524→```
   525→
   526→### Issue with Dependencies
   527→
   528→If issues depend on each other:
   529→
   530→```markdown
   531→⚠️ Issue #154 depends on #153. Run in order:
   532→
   533→1. /fullsolve 153
   534→2. (Wait for PR merge)
   535→3. /fullsolve 154
   536→```
   537→
   538→---
   539→
   540→## State Tracking
   541→
   542→**IMPORTANT:** `/solve` initializes issue state when analyzing issues.
   543→
   544→### State Updates
   545→
   546→When analyzing issues, initialize state tracking so the dashboard can show planned work:
   547→
   548→**Initialize each issue being analyzed:**
   549→```bash
   550→# Get issue title
   551→TITLE=$(gh issue view <issue-number> --json title -q '.title')
   552→
   553→# Initialize state (if not already tracked)
   554→npx tsx scripts/state/update.ts init <issue-number> "$TITLE"
   555→```
   556→
   557→**Note:** `/solve` only initializes issues - actual phase tracking happens during workflow execution (`/fullsolve`, `sequant run`, or individual skills).
   558→
   559→---
   560→
   561→## Output Verification
   562→
   563→**Before responding, verify your output includes ALL of these:**
   564→
   565→- [ ] **Header Box** — ASCII box with `sequant solve` and full command
   566→- [ ] **Issues List** — Each issue with dot leaders: `#N  Title ··· labels → workflow`
   567→- [ ] **Flags Table** — ALL five flags (-q, --chain, --qa-gate, --base, --testgen) with ✓/✗ and reasoning
   568→- [ ] **Why Section** — 3-5 bullet points explaining decisions
   569→- [ ] **Also Consider** — (conditional) Curated alternatives if applicable
   570→- [ ] **Conflict Warning** — (conditional) If in-flight work overlaps
   571→- [ ] **Line Count** — Total ≤25 lines (excluding conflict warnings)
   572→
   573→**DO NOT respond until all items are verified.**
   574→

content.content:
1→---
     2→name: merger
     3→description: "Multi-issue integration and merge skill - handles post-QA integration of completed worktrees"
     4→license: MIT
     5→metadata:
     6→  author: sequant
     7→  version: "1.0"
     8→allowed-tools:
     9→  - Bash(git:*)
    10→  - Bash(gh pr:*)
    11→  - Bash(gh issue:*)
    12→  - Bash(npm test:*)
    13→  - Bash(npm run build:*)
    14→  - Read
    15→  - Grep
    16→  - Glob
    17→---
    18→
    19→# Merger Skill
    20→
    21→You are the "Merger Agent" for handling post-QA integration of completed worktrees.
    22→
    23→## Purpose
    24→
    25→When invoked as `/merger <issue-numbers>`, you:
    26→1. Validate QA status for all specified issues
    27→2. Detect file conflicts between worktrees
    28→3. Generate integration branches for incompatible changes
    29→4. Respect dependency ordering
    30→5. Clean up worktrees after successful merge
    31→6. Provide detailed merge reports
    32→
    33→## Usage
    34→
    35→```bash
    36→# Merge single issue
    37→/merger 10
    38→
    39→# Merge multiple issues (detects conflicts, creates integration if needed)
    40→/merger 10 12
    41→
    42→# Merge with dependency ordering
    43→/merger 10 12 --order=dependency
    44→
    45→# Dry run - show what would happen
    46→/merger 10 12 --dry-run
    47→
    48→# Force parallel validation of multiple issues (faster, higher token usage)
    49→/merger 10 12 --parallel
    50→
    51→# Force sequential validation (slower, lower token usage)
    52→/merger 10 12 --sequential
    53→```
    54→
    55→## Agent Execution Mode
    56→
    57→When processing multiple issues, determine the execution mode for validation checks:
    58→
    59→1. **Check for CLI flag override:**
    60→   - `--parallel` → Validate all issues in parallel (spawn agents simultaneously)
    61→   - `--sequential` → Validate issues one at a time
    62→
    63→2. **If no flag, read project settings:**
    64→   Use the Read tool to check project settings:
    65→   ```
    66→   Read(file_path=".sequant/settings.json")
    67→   # Parse JSON and extract agents.parallel (default: false)
    68→   ```
    69→
    70→3. **Default:** Sequential (cost-optimized)
    71→
    72→| Mode | Token Usage | Speed | Best For |
    73→|------|-------------|-------|----------|
    74→| Sequential | 1x (baseline) | Slower | Limited API plans, 1-2 issues |
    75→| Parallel | ~Nx (N=issues) | ~50% faster | Unlimited plans, batch merges |
    76→
    77→## Workflow
    78→
    79→### Step 1: Pre-Merge Validation
    80→
    81→For each issue specified:
    82→
    83→```bash
    84→# Find the worktree for the issue
    85→git worktree list --porcelain | grep -A2 "feature/$ISSUE"
    86→
    87→# Check PR status
    88→gh pr list --head "feature/$ISSUE-*" --json number,state,title
    89→
    90→# Verify worktree exists and has commits
    91→git -C <worktree-path> log --oneline main..HEAD
    92→```
    93→
    94→Validation checklist:
    95→- [ ] Worktree exists for the issue
    96→- [ ] PR exists (or will be created)
    97→- [ ] Changes have been committed
    98→- [ ] No uncommitted work
    99→
   100→### Step 2: Conflict Detection
   101→
   102→Get files changed in each worktree:
   103→
   104→```bash
   105→# For each worktree
   106→git -C <worktree-path> diff --name-only main...HEAD
   107→```
   108→
   109→Find overlapping files:
   110→
   111→```bash
   112→# Compare file lists between worktrees
   113→comm -12 <(sort files_issue1.txt) <(sort files_issue2.txt)
   114→```
   115→
   116→### Step 3: Conflict Analysis
   117→
   118→If overlapping files found:
   119→
   120→1. **Semantic analysis**: Are the changes compatible?
   121→   - Additive changes (new functions) -> likely compatible
   122→   - Same function modified -> likely incompatible
   123→   - Same file, different sections -> may be compatible
   124→
   125→2. **Generate merge preview**:
   126→   ```bash
   127→   git merge-tree $(git merge-base main branch1) branch1 branch2
   128→   ```
   129→
   130→### Step 4: Resolution Strategy
   131→
   132→| Scenario | Action |
   133→|----------|--------|
   134→| No conflicts | Merge sequentially |
   135→| Compatible changes | Auto-merge with verification |
   136→| Incompatible changes | Generate unified implementation in integration branch |
   137→| True dependency | Enforce merge order |
   138→
   139→### Step 5: Merge Execution
   140→
   141→#### For clean merges (no conflicts):
   142→
   143→```bash
   144→# IMPORTANT: Remove worktree BEFORE merge (prevents --delete-branch failure)
   145→worktree_path=$(git worktree list | grep "feature/$ISSUE" | awk '{print $1}')
   146→if [[ -n "$worktree_path" ]]; then
   147→  git worktree remove "$worktree_path" --force
   148→  git branch -D "feature/$ISSUE-"* 2>/dev/null || true
   149→fi
   150→
   151→# Merge PR using squash
   152→gh pr merge <PR_NUMBER> --squash --delete-branch
   153→
   154→# REQUIRED: Update state to mark issue as merged (#305)
   155→npx tsx scripts/state/update.ts merged $ISSUE
   156→```
   157→
   158→#### For conflicting changes (integration branch):
   159→
   160→```bash
   161→# Create integration branch
   162→git checkout -b integrate/<issue1>-<issue2>-<description> main
   163→
   164→# Cherry-pick or merge each worktree's changes
   165→git merge feature/<issue1>-* --no-commit
   166→# Resolve conflicts...
   167→git add .
   168→git commit -m "feat: Integrate #<issue1> changes"
   169→
   170→git merge feature/<issue2>-* --no-commit
   171→# Resolve conflicts...
   172→git add .
   173→git commit -m "feat: Integrate #<issue2> changes"
   174→
   175→# Run tests on integration branch
   176→npm test
   177→npm run build
   178→
   179→# Create integration PR
   180→gh pr create --title "feat: Integrate #<issue1> and #<issue2>" --body "..."
   181→```
   182→
   183→### Step 6: Post-Merge Verification
   184→
   185→After successful merge:
   186→
   187→```bash
   188→# Pull merged changes to main
   189→git checkout main
   190→git pull origin main
   191→
   192→# Verify worktree was cleaned up
   193→git worktree list  # Should not show the merged feature branch
   194→
   195→# Remote branch is deleted by --delete-branch flag
   196→
   197→# REQUIRED: Verify state was updated (#305)
   198→# The state should show status="merged" for the issue
   199→# Use the Read tool to check state, then parse JSON
   200→Read(file_path=".sequant/state.json")
   201→# Verify the issue status shows "merged"
   202→```
   203→
   204→### Step 6a: Worktree Cleanup After Merge (REQUIRED - #305)
   205→
   206→**After each successful merge, ensure the worktree is removed:**
   207→
   208→```bash
   209→# Find and remove worktree for the issue
   210→worktree_path=$(git worktree list | grep "feature/$ISSUE" | awk '{print $1}')
   211→if [[ -n "$worktree_path" ]]; then
   212→  echo "Removing worktree: $worktree_path"
   213→  git worktree remove "$worktree_path" --force
   214→else
   215→  echo "No worktree found for #$ISSUE (already cleaned up)"
   216→fi
   217→
   218→# Verify worktree removal
   219→git worktree list | grep -q "feature/$ISSUE" && echo "WARNING: Worktree still exists" || echo "✅ Worktree removed"
   220→```
   221→
   222→**Why this matters:** Leftover worktrees waste disk space and can cause confusion when re-running `sequant run` on the same issues. The state guard (#305) prevents re-execution, but the worktree should still be cleaned up.
   223→
   224→## Dependency Detection
   225→
   226→Parse dependencies from issue body or comments:
   227→
   228→```markdown
   229→<!-- In issue body -->
   230→**Depends on**: #10
   231→
   232→<!-- Or via label -->
   233→Labels: depends-on/10
   234→```
   235→
   236→```bash
   237→# Check issue for dependency markers
   238→gh issue view <issue> --json body,labels | jq '.body, .labels[].name'
   239→```
   240→
   241→If dependencies found, enforce merge order.
   242→
   243→## Output Format
   244→
   245→### Merge Report
   246→
   247→```markdown
   248→## Merger Report: Issues #10, #12
   249→
   250→### Pre-Merge Validation
   251→| Issue | Worktree | PR | Status |
   252→|-------|----------|-----|--------|
   253→| #10 | feature/10-* | #15 | Ready |
   254→| #12 | feature/12-* | #16 | Ready |
   255→
   256→### Conflict Analysis
   257→| File | #10 | #12 | Status |
   258→|------|-----|-----|--------|
   259→| `src/api/route.ts` | Modified | Modified | CONFLICT |
   260→| `src/components/list.tsx` | - | Created | OK |
   261→
   262→### Resolution
   263→**Strategy:** Integration branch
   264→**Branch:** integrate/10-12-api-merge
   265→**PR:** #17
   266→
   267→### Actions Taken
   268→1. Created integration branch from main
   269→2. Merged #10 changes (no conflicts)
   270→3. Merged #12 changes (resolved 1 conflict in route.ts)
   271→4. Tests passed (45 tests)
   272→5. Build succeeded
   273→
   274→### Cleanup
   275→- Removed worktree: feature/10-*
   276→- Removed worktree: feature/12-*
   277→- Closed: PR #15, PR #16 (superseded by #17)
   278→
   279→### Final Status
   280→**Result:** SUCCESS
   281→**Integration PR:** #17
   282→**Issues to close on merge:** #10, #12
   283→```
   284→
   285→## Error Handling
   286→
   287→**If validation fails:**
   288→- Report which issues failed validation
   289→- Suggest corrective actions
   290→- Do not proceed with merge
   291→
   292→**If merge conflicts cannot be resolved:**
   293→- Document the conflicts
   294→- Create a draft PR with conflicts marked
   295→- Request manual intervention
   296→
   297→**If tests fail on integration branch:**
   298→- Document failing tests
   299→- Keep integration branch for debugging
   300→- Do not merge
   301→
   302→**If worktree cleanup fails:**
   303→- Log warning but continue
   304→- Manual cleanup may be needed
   305→
   306→## Configuration
   307→
   308→Environment variables:
   309→- `SEQUANT_MERGER_DRY_RUN` - If true, only show what would happen
   310→- `SEQUANT_MERGER_NO_CLEANUP` - If true, keep worktrees after merge
   311→- `SEQUANT_MERGER_FORCE` - If true, proceed even with conflicts
   312→
   313→## State Tracking
   314→
   315→**IMPORTANT:** `/merger` updates state for merged issues.
   316→
   317→### State Updates
   318→
   319→When merging issues, update state to reflect the merge:
   320→
   321→**After successful merge of each issue:**
   322→```bash
   323→npx tsx scripts/state/update.ts merged <issue-number>
   324→```
   325→
   326→**For integration branches (multiple issues merged together):**
   327→```bash
   328→# Mark all integrated issues as merged
   329→npx tsx scripts/state/update.ts merged <issue-1>
   330→npx tsx scripts/state/update.ts merged <issue-2>
   331→```
   332→
   333→**On merge failure:**
   334→```bash
   335→npx tsx scripts/state/update.ts fail <issue-number> merger "Merge conflict or CI failure"
   336→```
   337→
   338→**Why this matters:** The dashboard shows merged issues as complete, and state tracking enables accurate workflow metrics.
   339→
   340→---
   341→
   342→## Output Verification
   343→
   344→**Before responding, verify your output includes ALL of these:**
   345→
   346→- [ ] **Pre-Merge Validation** - Status of each issue/worktree/PR
   347→- [ ] **Conflict Analysis** - Table of overlapping files and status
   348→- [ ] **Resolution Strategy** - How conflicts were resolved (if any)
   349→- [ ] **Actions Taken** - Step-by-step log of what was done
   350→- [ ] **Cleanup Status** - Which worktrees/branches were removed
   351→- [ ] **Final Status** - SUCCESS/FAILURE with PR link
   352→
   353→**DO NOT respond until all items are verified.**
   354→

content.content:
1→---
     2→name: fullsolve
     3→description: "Complete issue resolution with integrated quality loops - spec → exec → test → qa with auto-fix iterations"
     4→license: MIT
     5→metadata:
     6→  author: sequant
     7→  version: "1.0"
     8→allowed-tools:
     9→  - Read
    10→  - Edit
    11→  - Write
    12→  - Glob
    13→  - Grep
    14→  - Bash
    15→  - TodoWrite
    16→  - Skill  # For invoking child skills (/spec, /exec, /test, /qa)
    17→  # Optional MCP tools (enhanced functionality if available)
    18→  - mcp__chrome-devtools__*  # Browser testing - falls back to manual checklist if unavailable
    19→  - mcp__sequential-thinking__*  # Complex reasoning - falls back to standard analysis if unavailable
    20→  - mcp__context7__*  # Library documentation - falls back to web search if unavailable
    21→  - Bash(gh issue view:*)
    22→  - Bash(gh issue comment:*)
    23→  - Bash(gh issue edit:*)
    24→  - Bash(gh pr create:*)
    25→  - Bash(gh pr list:*)
    26→  - Bash(gh pr merge:*)
    27→  - Bash(npm test:*)
    28→  - Bash(npm run build:*)
    29→  - Bash(git diff:*)
    30→  - Bash(git status:*)
    31→  - Bash(git log:*)
    32→  - Bash(git add:*)
    33→  - Bash(git commit:*)
    34→  - Bash(git push:*)
    35→  - Bash(git worktree:*)
    36→  - Bash(./scripts/dev/*:*)
    37→---
    38→
    39→# Full Solve Command
    40→
    41→You are the "Full Solve Agent" for the current repository.
    42→
    43→## Purpose
    44→
    45→When invoked as `/fullsolve <issue-number>`, execute the complete issue resolution workflow with integrated quality loops. This command orchestrates all phases and automatically iterates until quality gates pass.
    46→
    47→## CRITICAL: Auto-Progression Between Phases
    48→
    49→**DO NOT wait for user confirmation between phases.** This is an autonomous workflow.
    50→
    51→After each phase completes successfully, **immediately proceed** to the next phase:
    52→1. `/spec` completes → **immediately** invoke `/exec`
    53→2. `/exec` completes → **immediately** invoke `/test` (if UI) or `/qa`
    54→3. `/test` completes → **immediately** invoke `/qa`
    55→4. `/qa` completes → **immediately** create PR
    56→
    57→**The user invoked `/fullsolve` expecting end-to-end automation.** Only stop for:
    58→- Unrecoverable errors (after retry attempts exhausted)
    59→- Final summary after PR creation
    60→- Explicit user interruption
    61→
    62→```
    63→WRONG: "Spec complete. Ready for exec phase." [waits]
    64→RIGHT: "Spec complete. Proceeding to exec..." [invokes /exec immediately]
    65→```
    66→
    67→## Workflow Overview
    68→
    69→```
    70→                    /fullsolve <issue>
    71→├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
    72→│                                                             │
    73→│  ┌─────────┐                                                │
    74→│  │  SPEC   │ Plan implementation, extract AC                │
    75→│  └────┬────┘                                                │
    76→│       │                                                     │
    77→│       ▼                                                     │
    78→│  ┌─────────┐                                                │
    79→│  │  EXEC   │ Implement in feature worktree                  │
    80→│  └────┬────┘                                                │
    81→│       │                                                     │
    82→│       ▼                                                     │
    83→│  ┌─────────┐                                                │
    84→│  │  TEST   │ Browser-based testing (if UI feature)          │
    85→│  └────┬────┘                                                │
    86→│       │                                                     │
    87→│       ▼ (failures?)                                         │
    88→│  ┌─────────┐     ┌─────────┐                                │
    89→│  │  FIX    │────▶│ RE-TEST │──▶ (loop max 3x)               │
    90→│  └─────────┘     └─────────┘                                │
    91→│       │                                                     │
    92→│       ▼ (all pass)                                          │
    93→│  ┌─────────┐                                                │
    94→│  │   QA    │ Code review, AC validation                     │
    95→│  └────┬────┘                                                │
    96→│       │                                                     │
    97→│       ▼ (not ready?)                                        │
    98→│  ┌─────────┐     ┌─────────┐                                │
    99→│  │  FIX    │────▶│  RE-QA  │──▶ (loop max 2x)               │
   100→│  └─────────┘     └─────────┘                                │
   101→│       │                                                     │
   102→│       ▼ (READY_FOR_MERGE)                                   │
   103→│  ┌─────────┐                                                │
   104→│  │   PR    │ Create PR if not exists                        │
   105→│  └─────────┘                                                │
   106→└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
   107→```
   108→
   109→## Invocation
   110→
   111→```bash
   112→/fullsolve 218                    # Standard full solve
   113→/fullsolve 218 --skip-test        # Skip testing phase (backend issues)
   114→/fullsolve 218 --max-iterations 5 # Override max fix iterations
   115→/fullsolve 218 --parallel         # Force parallel agent execution (faster, higher token usage)
   116→/fullsolve 218 --sequential       # Force sequential agent execution (slower, lower token usage)
   117→```
   118→
   119→## Agent Execution Mode
   120→
   121→When spawning sub-agents for quality checks, determine the execution mode:
   122→
   123→1. **Check for CLI flag override:**
   124→   - `--parallel` → Run sub-agents in parallel
   125→   - `--sequential` → Run sub-agents one at a time
   126→
   127→2. **If no flag, read project settings:**
   128→   Use the Read tool to check project settings:
   129→   ```
   130→   Read(file_path=".sequant/settings.json")
   131→   # Parse JSON and extract agents.parallel (default: false)
   132→   ```
   133→
   134→3. **Default:** Sequential (cost-optimized)
   135→
   136→| Mode | Token Usage | Speed | Best For |
   137→|------|-------------|-------|----------|
   138→| Sequential | 1x (baseline) | Slower | Limited API plans, single issues |
   139→| Parallel | ~2-3x | ~50% faster | Unlimited plans, batch operations |
   140→
   141→**Pass execution mode to child skills:** When invoking `/qa` or other skills that spawn agents, pass the `--parallel` or `--sequential` flag to maintain consistency.
   142→
   143→## Orchestration Context
   144→
   145→This skill acts as an **orchestrator** and sets environment variables for child skills to optimize their behavior:
   146→
   147→| Environment Variable | Description | Example Value |
   148→|---------------------|-------------|---------------|
   149→| `SEQUANT_ORCHESTRATOR` | Identifies the orchestrator | `sequant-run` |
   150→| `SEQUANT_PHASE` | Current phase being executed | `spec`, `exec`, `test`, `qa`, `loop` |
   151→| `SEQUANT_ISSUE` | Issue number being processed | `218` |
   152→| `SEQUANT_WORKTREE` | Path to the feature worktree | `/path/to/worktrees/feature/218-...` |
   153→
   154→**Benefits of orchestration context:**
   155→
   156→1. **Faster execution** - Child skills skip redundant pre-flight checks
   157→2. **Cleaner GitHub comments** - Only orchestrator posts progress updates
   158→3. **Better coordination** - Skills can trust worktree and issue context
   159→4. **Reduced API calls** - Issue fetch happens once, not per-phase
   160→
   161→**Child skills detect orchestration via `SEQUANT_ORCHESTRATOR` and adjust behavior:**
   162→- `/spec`: Runs normally (first phase, no prior context)
   163→- `/exec`: Skips worktree creation, uses provided path
   164→- `/test`: Skips issue fetch, trusts orchestrator context
   165→- `/qa`: Skips pre-flight sync, defers GitHub updates
   166→- `/loop`: Uses provided worktree, defers GitHub updates
   167→
   168→## Phase Detection (Smart Resumption)
   169→
   170→**Before starting any phase**, detect the current workflow state from GitHub issue comments to enable smart resumption:
   171→
   172→```bash
   173→# Get all phase markers from issue comments
   174→comments_json=$(gh issue view <issue-number> --json comments --jq '[.comments[].body]')
   175→markers=$(echo "$comments_json" | grep -o '{[^}]*}' | grep '"phase"')
   176→
   177→if [[ -n "$markers" ]]; then
   178→  echo "Phase markers detected:"
   179→  echo "$markers" | jq -r '"  \(.phase): \(.status)"'
   180→
   181→  # Determine resume point
   182→  latest_completed=$(echo "$markers" | jq -r 'select(.status == "completed") | .phase' | tail -1)
   183→  latest_failed=$(echo "$markers" | jq -r 'select(.status == "failed") | .phase' | tail -1)
   184→
   185→  echo "Latest completed: ${latest_completed:-none}"
   186→  echo "Latest failed: ${latest_failed:-none}"
   187→fi
   188→```
   189→
   190→**Resume Logic:**
   191→
   192→| Detected State | Action |
   193→|---------------|--------|
   194→| No markers | Start from Phase 1 (spec) — fresh start |
   195→| `spec:completed` | Skip to Phase 2 (exec) |
   196→| `exec:completed` | Skip to Phase 3 (test) or Phase 4 (qa) |
   197→| `exec:failed` | Resume at Phase 2 (exec) — retry |
   198→| `test:completed` | Skip to Phase 4 (qa) |
   199→| `qa:completed` | Skip to Phase 5 (PR) |
   200→| `qa:failed` | Resume at Phase 4 (qa) — retry with /loop |
   201→| All completed | Skip to PR creation (if no PR exists) |
   202→
   203→**Backward Compatibility:**
   204→- Issues without markers → treat as fresh start (no phase detection)
   205→- If detection fails (API error) → fall through to standard Phase 0 checks
   206→
   207→**Phase Marker Emission:**
   208→
   209→When posting progress comments after each phase, append the appropriate marker:
   210→```markdown
   211→<!-- SEQUANT_PHASE: {"phase":"<phase>","status":"<completed|failed>","timestamp":"<ISO-8601>"} -->
   212→```
   213→
   214→## Phase 0: Pre-flight Checks
   215→
   216→**CRITICAL after context restoration:** Before starting any work, verify the current git state to avoid duplicate work.
   217→
   218→### 0.1 Git State Verification
   219→
   220→```bash
   221→# Check current branch and recent commits
   222→git log --oneline -5 --stat
   223→
   224→# Check for any existing work on this issue
   225→git branch -a | grep -i "<issue-number>"
   226→gh pr list --search "<issue-number>"
   227→```
   228→
   229→**Why this matters:** After context restoration from a summarized conversation, the git state may have changed (PRs merged, rebases, etc.). Always verify what's already been done before creating files or making changes.
   230→
   231→### 0.2 Existing Work Detection
   232→
   233→Before creating any files, check if they already exist:
   234→- Look for test files: `ls -la src/**/*.test.ts`
   235→- Check recent commits for relevant changes
   236→- Verify PR status if one was mentioned in context
   237→
   238→**If work already exists:** Skip to the appropriate phase (e.g., if implementation is done, go to Phase 3 or 4).
   239→
   240→## Phase 1: Planning (SPEC)
   241→
   242→**Invoke the `/spec` skill** to plan implementation and extract acceptance criteria.
   243→
   244→### 1.1 Invoke Spec Skill
   245→
   246→Use the `Skill` tool to invoke `/spec`:
   247→
   248→```
   249→Skill(skill: "spec", args: "<issue-number>")
   250→```
   251→
   252→The `/spec` skill will:
   253→- Fetch issue context from GitHub
   254→- Extract acceptance criteria (AC-1, AC-2, etc.)
   255→- Create implementation plan (3-7 steps)
   256→- Post plan comment to the issue
   257→- Create feature worktree
   258→
   259→### 1.2 Capture Spec Output
   260→
   261→After `/spec` completes, extract and store:
   262→- **AC Checklist:** List of acceptance criteria for tracking
   263→- **Worktree Path:** Location for subsequent phases
   264→- **Recommended Phases:** Whether `/test` is needed (UI features)
   265→
   266→```markdown
   267→## Spec Output Captured
   268→
   269→**Issue:** #<N>
   270→**Worktree:** ../worktrees/feature/<issue-number>-*/
   271→**AC Count:** <N> items
   272→**Needs Testing:** Yes/No (based on labels)
   273→```
   274→
   275→### 1.3 Handle Spec Failures
   276→
   277→If `/spec` fails:
   278→- Check if issue exists and is readable
   279→- Verify GitHub CLI authentication
   280→- Report failure and exit workflow
   281→
   282→```markdown
   283→## Spec Failed
   284→
   285→**Error:** [error message]
   286→**Action Required:** [what the user needs to do]
   287→
   288→Workflow halted. Fix the issue and re-run `/fullsolve <issue-number>`.
   289→```
   290→
   291→**State after Phase 1:**
   292→- AC checklist defined
   293→- Implementation plan created (and posted to GitHub)
   294→- Feature worktree ready
   295→
   296→**→ IMMEDIATELY proceed to Phase 2 (do not wait for user input)**
   297→
   298→## Phase 2: Implementation (EXEC)
   299→
   300→**Invoke the `/exec` skill** to implement all acceptance criteria.
   301→
   302→### 2.1 Invoke Exec Skill
   303→
   304→Use the `Skill` tool to invoke `/exec`:
   305→
   306→```
   307→Skill(skill: "exec", args: "<issue-number>")
   308→```
   309→
   310→The `/exec` skill will:
   311→- Navigate to the feature worktree
   312→- Implement each AC item
   313→- Run tests and build after changes
   314→- Verify quality gates pass
   315→
   316→### 2.2 Pass Orchestration Context
   317→
   318→Set environment variables before invoking `/exec` so it can optimize its behavior:
   319→
   320→```bash
   321→export SEQUANT_ORCHESTRATOR=fullsolve
   322→export SEQUANT_PHASE=exec
   323→export SEQUANT_ISSUE=<issue-number>
   324→export SEQUANT_WORKTREE=../worktrees/feature/<issue-number>-*/
   325→```
   326→
   327→When `/exec` detects `SEQUANT_ORCHESTRATOR`, it:
   328→- Skips worktree creation (already done by `/spec`)
   329→- Uses the provided worktree path
   330→- Defers GitHub comment updates to orchestrator
   331→
   332→### 2.3 Handle Exec Failures
   333→
   334→If `/exec` fails (tests or build):
   335→
   336→**Attempt fix (max 3 iterations):**
   337→```
   338→exec_iteration = 0
   339→while exec_iteration < MAX_EXEC_ITERATIONS:
   340→    result = Skill(skill: "exec", args: "<issue-number>")
   341→
   342→    if result.success:
   343→        break
   344→
   345→    # Parse and log failure
   346→    log_failure(result.error)
   347→    exec_iteration += 1
   348→```
   349→
   350→**If all iterations exhausted:**
   351→```markdown
   352→## Exec Failed
   353→
   354→**Iterations:** 3/3 exhausted
   355→**Last Error:** [error message]
   356→
   357→Workflow halted. Manual intervention required.
   358→```
   359→
   360→### 2.4 Capture Exec Output
   361→
   362→After successful `/exec`:
   363→- Verify tests passed
   364→- Verify build succeeded
   365→- Record files changed
   366→
   367→```markdown
   368→## Exec Complete
   369→
   370→**Tests:** ✅ All passing
   371→**Build:** ✅ Succeeded
   372→**Files Changed:** <N>
   373→```
   374→
   375→**State after Phase 2:**
   376→- All AC items implemented
   377→- Tests passing (verified AFTER final changes)
   378→- Build succeeding
   379→
   380→**→ IMMEDIATELY proceed to Phase 3 or 4 (do not wait for user input)**
   381→- If UI labels present → invoke `/test`
   382→- Otherwise → skip to `/qa`
   383→
   384→## Phase 3: Testing (TEST)
   385→
   386→**Skip if:** Issue doesn't have `admin`, `ui`, or `frontend` labels (determined from `/spec` output)
   387→
   388→**Invoke the `/test` skill** for browser-based UI testing.
   389→
   390→### 3.1 Invoke Test Skill
   391→
   392→Use the `Skill` tool to invoke `/test`:
   393→
   394→```
   395→Skill(skill: "test", args: "<issue-number>")
   396→```
   397→
   398→The `/test` skill will:
   399→- Start development server
   400→- Navigate to feature in browser (Chrome DevTools MCP)
   401→- Execute each test case
   402→- Record PASS/FAIL/BLOCKED results
   403→
   404→### 3.2 Pass Orchestration Context
   405→
   406→```bash
   407→export SEQUANT_ORCHESTRATOR=fullsolve
   408→export SEQUANT_PHASE=test
   409→export SEQUANT_ISSUE=<issue-number>
   410→export SEQUANT_WORKTREE=../worktrees/feature/<issue-number>-*/
   411→```
   412→
   413→When `/test` detects `SEQUANT_ORCHESTRATOR`, it:
   414→- Skips issue fetch (trusts orchestrator context)
   415→- Uses provided AC checklist
   416→- Defers GitHub updates to orchestrator
   417→
   418→### 3.3 Test Loop (Max 3 iterations)
   419→
   420→If tests fail, invoke `/loop` to fix and re-test:
   421→
   422→```
   423→test_iteration = 0
   424→while test_iteration < MAX_TEST_ITERATIONS:
   425→    result = Skill(skill: "test", args: "<issue-number>")
   426→
   427→    if result.all_tests_pass:
   428→        break
   429→
   430→    # Use /loop to fix failures
   431→    Skill(skill: "loop", args: "<issue-number> --phase test")
   432→    test_iteration += 1
   433→```
   434→
   435→### 3.4 Handle Test Exhaustion
   436→
   437→If max iterations reached:
   438→
   439→```markdown
   440→## Test Loop Exhausted
   441→
   442→**Iterations:** 3/3
   443→**Remaining Failures:** [list]
   444→
   445→Proceeding to QA phase. Failures will be documented.
   446→```
   447→
   448→**State after Phase 3:**
   449→- All tests passing (or max iterations reached)
   450→- Bugs documented and fixed
   451→
   452→**→ IMMEDIATELY proceed to Phase 4 (do not wait for user input)**
   453→
   454→## Phase 4: Quality Assurance (QA)
   455→
   456→**Invoke the `/qa` skill** for code review and AC validation.
   457→
   458→### 4.1 Invoke QA Skill
   459→
   460→Use the `Skill` tool to invoke `/qa`:
   461→
   462→```
   463→Skill(skill: "qa", args: "<issue-number>")
   464→```
   465→
   466→The `/qa` skill will:
   467→- Run automated quality checks (type safety, deleted tests, scope)
   468→- Review AC coverage (MET/PARTIALLY_MET/NOT_MET/PENDING)
   469→- Generate review comment draft
   470→- Return verdict: READY_FOR_MERGE, AC_MET_BUT_NOT_A_PLUS, NEEDS_VERIFICATION,
   471→  or AC_NOT_MET
   472→
   473→### 4.2 Pass Orchestration Context
   474→
   475→```bash
   476→export SEQUANT_ORCHESTRATOR=fullsolve
   477→export SEQUANT_PHASE=qa
   478→export SEQUANT_ISSUE=<issue-number>
   479→export SEQUANT_WORKTREE=../worktrees/feature/<issue-number>-*/
   480→```
   481→
   482→When `/qa` detects `SEQUANT_ORCHESTRATOR`, it:
   483→- Skips pre-flight sync
   484→- Defers GitHub comment posting to orchestrator
   485→- Returns structured verdict for orchestrator to process
   486→
   487→### 4.3 QA Loop (Max 2 iterations)
   488→
   489→If verdict is not `READY_FOR_MERGE`, invoke `/loop` to fix and re-run QA:
   490→
   491→```
   492→qa_iteration = 0
   493→while qa_iteration < MAX_QA_ITERATIONS:
   494→    result = Skill(skill: "qa", args: "<issue-number>")
   495→
   496→    if result.verdict == "READY_FOR_MERGE":
   497→        break
   498→
   499→    if result.verdict == "AC_MET_BUT_NOT_A_PLUS":
   500→        # Good enough, proceed with notes
   501→        break
   502→
   503→    if result.verdict == "NEEDS_VERIFICATION":
   504→        # ACs are met but pending external verification
   505→        # Proceed to PR - verification can happen post-PR
   506→        break
   507→
   508→    # Use /loop to fix issues (AC_NOT_MET)
   509→    Skill(skill: "loop", args: "<issue-number> --phase qa")
   510→    qa_iteration += 1
   511→```
   512→
   513→### 4.4 Handle QA Exhaustion
   514→
   515→If max iterations reached with `AC_NOT_MET`:
   516→
   517→```markdown
   518→## QA Loop Exhausted
   519→
   520→**Iterations:** 2/2
   521→**Verdict:** AC_NOT_MET
   522→**Remaining Issues:** [list]
   523→
   524→Creating PR with notes for human review.
   525→```
   526→
   527→**State after Phase 4:**
   528→- AC fully met (or documented as partial)
   529→- Code quality validated
   530→- Ready for merge (or flagged for human review)
   531→
   532→**→ IMMEDIATELY proceed to Phase 5 after self-evaluation (do not wait for user input)**
   533→
   534→### 4.5 Adversarial Self-Evaluation (REQUIRED)
   535→
   536→**Before proceeding to PR creation**, you MUST complete this adversarial self-evaluation to catch issues that all automated phases missed.
   537→
   538→**Why this matters:** The full workflow passes automated checks, but honest self-reflection catches:
   539→- Features that don't actually work as expected
   540→- Edge cases that weren't tested
   541→- Integration issues with existing features
   542→- Success metrics reported without honest evaluation
   543→
   544→**Answer these questions honestly:**
   545→1. "Did anything not work as expected during the entire workflow?"
   546→2. "If this feature broke tomorrow, would the current tests catch it?"
   547→3. "What's the weakest part of this implementation?"
   548→4. "Am I reporting success because checks passed, or because I verified it actually works?"
   549→
   550→**Include this section in your output:**
   551→
   552→```markdown
   553→### Self-Evaluation
   554→
   555→- **Worked as expected:** [Yes/No - if No, explain what didn't work]
   556→- **Test coverage confidence:** [High/Medium/Low - explain why]
   557→- **Weakest part:** [Identify the weakest aspect of the implementation]
   558→- **Honest assessment:** [Any concerns or caveats about this PR?]
   559→```
   560→
   561→**If any answer reveals concerns:**
   562→- Address the issues before proceeding to PR creation
   563→- Re-run relevant quality checks
   564→- Update the self-evaluation after fixes
   565→
   566→**Do NOT skip this self-evaluation.** This is the last opportunity to catch issues before the PR is created.
   567→
   568→---
   569→
   570→## Phase 5: Pull Request (PR)
   571→
   572→### 5.1 Create PR (if not exists)
   573→
   574→```bash
   575→# Check for existing PR
   576→gh pr list --head feature/<issue-number>-*
   577→
   578→# Create if none exists
   579→gh pr create --title "feat(#<N>): <title>" --body "..."
   580→```
   581→
   582→### 5.2 Final Summary
   583→
   584→Post completion comment to issue with:
   585→- AC coverage summary
   586→- Key changes made
   587→- PR link
   588→- Quality metrics
   589→
   590→### 5.3 Merge Workflow (Correct Order)
   591→
   592→**IMPORTANT:** Merge the PR first, then clean up the worktree.
   593→
   594→```bash
   595→# 1. Merge PR (--delete-branch deletes remote; local deletion will fail but that's OK)
   596→gh pr merge <N> --squash --delete-branch
   597→
   598→# 2. Clean up worktree (removes local worktree + branch)
   599→./scripts/dev/cleanup-worktree.sh feature/<issue-number>-*
   600→
   601→# 3. Issue auto-closes if commit message contains "Fixes #N"
   602→```
   603→
   604→**Why this order matters:** The cleanup script checks if the PR is merged before proceeding. The `--delete-branch` flag will fail to delete the local branch (worktree conflict) but successfully deletes the remote branch. The cleanup script then handles the local branch removal.
   605→
   606→### 5.4 Post-Merge Verification
   607→
   608→**Recommended:** After merge, verify the build and CLI still work:
   609→
   610→```bash
   611→# Pull latest main
   612→git pull origin main
   613→
   614→# Rebuild and verify
   615→npm run build
   616→
   617→# Smoke test - verify CLI runs without errors
   618→npx sequant doctor
   619→```
   620→
   621→If any command fails, fix immediately on main before continuing. This catches issues like ESM compatibility bugs that unit tests may miss.
   622→
   623→## Iteration Tracking
   624→
   625→Track iterations to prevent infinite loops:
   626→
   627→```markdown
   628→## Full Solve Progress
   629→
   630→| Phase | Iterations | Status |
   631→|-------|------------|--------|
   632→| Spec  | 1/1        | Complete |
   633→| Exec  | 1/1        | Complete |
   634→| Test  | 2/3        | Complete (fixed 2 bugs) |
   635→| QA    | 1/2        | Complete |
   636→
   637→**Total Time:** [tracked]
   638→**Final Verdict:** READY_FOR_MERGE
   639→```
   640→
   641→## Exit Conditions
   642→
   643→**Success:**
   644→- All AC met
   645→- All tests passing
   646→- QA verdict: `READY_FOR_MERGE`
   647→- PR created
   648→
   649→**Partial Success:**
   650→- Most AC met
   651→- Minor issues documented
   652→- QA verdict: `AC_MET_BUT_NOT_A_PLUS`
   653→- PR created with notes
   654→
   655→**Pending Verification:**
   656→
   657→- All AC met or pending
   658→- External verification required (CI, manual test)
   659→- QA verdict: `NEEDS_VERIFICATION`
   660→- PR created, verification can happen post-PR
   661→
   662→**Failure (manual intervention needed):**
   663→- Max iterations reached on test or QA loop
   664→- Blockers discovered
   665→- QA verdict: `AC_NOT_MET` after all iterations
   666→
   667→## GitHub Updates
   668→
   669→Throughout the process, post progress comments:
   670→
   671→**After Spec:**
   672→```markdown
   673→## Plan Complete
   674→
   675→### AC Checklist
   676→- [ ] AC-1: ...
   677→- [ ] AC-2: ...
   678→
   679→### Implementation Plan
   680→1. Step 1
   681→2. Step 2
   682→
   683→Ready to implement.
   684→```
   685→
   686→**After Test Loop:**

   690→**Result:** 10/10 tests passed
   691→**Iterations:** 2 (fixed 2 bugs)
   692→
   693→### Bugs Fixed
   694→1. [Bug] - Fixed in [file:line]
   695→```
   696→
   697→**Final Comment:**
   698→```markdown
   699→## /fullsolve Complete
   700→
   701→**Issue:** #<N>
   702→**Status:** READY_FOR_MERGE
   703→
   704→### Summary
   705→- AC: 5/5 met
   706→- Tests: 10/10 passed
   707→- QA: All checks passed
   708→
   709→### Iterations
   710→- Test loop: 2
   711→- QA loop: 1
   712→

   714→

   717→```
   718→
   719→## Error Recovery
   720→
   721→**If spec fails:**
   722→- Check issue exists and is readable
   723→- Verify GitHub CLI authentication
   724→- Exit with clear error
   725→
   726→**If exec fails (build/test):**
   727→- Check error logs
   728→- Attempt targeted fix
   729→- If persistent, document and exit
   730→
   731→**If test loop exhausted:**
   732→- Document remaining failures
   733→- Post status to issue
   734→- Continue to QA (may catch issues there)
   735→
   736→**If QA loop exhausted:**
   737→- Document remaining issues
   738→- Create PR anyway with notes
   739→- Flag for human review
   740→
   741→## Configuration
   742→
   743→| Setting | Default | Description |
   744→|---------|---------|-------------|
   745→| MAX_TEST_ITERATIONS | 3 | Max fix loops for test phase |
   746→| MAX_QA_ITERATIONS | 2 | Max fix loops for QA phase |
   747→| SKIP_TEST | false | Skip testing phase |
   748→| AUTO_PR | true | Create PR automatically |
   749→
   750→## Smart Tests Integration
   751→
   752→**Recommended:** Enable smart tests for automatic test running during implementation:
   753→
   754→```bash
   755→# Enable before running fullsolve
   756→export CLAUDE_HOOKS_SMART_TESTS=true
   757→```
   758→
   759→When enabled, smart tests will:
   760→- Auto-run related tests after each file edit during Phase 2 (EXEC)
   761→- Catch regressions immediately instead of waiting for explicit `npm test`
   762→- Log results to `/tmp/claude-tests.log` for debugging
   763→
   764→**Benefits:**
   765→- Faster feedback loop during implementation
   766→- Catches test failures as they happen
   767→- Reduces QA iteration count
   768→
   769→**Trade-off:** Adds ~5-10s per file edit for test execution.
   770→
   771→**View test results:**
   772→```bash
   773→npx tsx scripts/dev/analyze-hook-logs.ts --tests
   774→```
   775→
   776→## Usage Examples
   777→
   778→**Standard full solve:**
   779→```
   780→/fullsolve 218
   781→```
   782→
   783→**Backend issue (no UI testing):**
   784→```
   785→/fullsolve 218 --skip-test
   786→```
   787→
   788→**With more iteration tolerance:**
   789→```
   790→/fullsolve 218 --max-iterations 5
   791→```
   792→
   793→## Batch Processing
   794→
   795→For multiple issues, run `/fullsolve` on each sequentially:
   796→
   797→```bash
   798→# Process multiple issues one at a time
   799→/fullsolve 218
   800→/fullsolve 219
   801→/fullsolve 220
   802→```
   803→
   804→Each issue gets its own worktree, PR, and quality validation.

   806→---
   807→
   808→## State Tracking
   809→
   810→**IMPORTANT:** `/fullsolve` is an orchestrator and manages state for child skills.
   811→
   812→### Orchestrator Responsibilities
   813→
   814→As an orchestrator, `/fullsolve` must:
   815→
   816→1. **Set orchestration context** for child skills:
   817→   ```bash
   818→   export SEQUANT_ORCHESTRATOR=fullsolve
   819→   export SEQUANT_PHASE=<current-phase>
   820→   export SEQUANT_ISSUE=<issue-number>
   821→   export SEQUANT_WORKTREE=<worktree-path>
   822→   ```
   823→
   824→2. **Initialize issue state at workflow start:**
   825→   ```bash
   826→   npx tsx scripts/state/update.ts init <issue-number> "<issue-title>"
   827→   ```
   828→
   829→3. **Update phase status** at each transition:
   830→   ```bash
   831→   # Before invoking child skill
   832→   npx tsx scripts/state/update.ts start <issue-number> <phase>
   833→
   834→   # After child skill completes
   835→   npx tsx scripts/state/update.ts complete <issue-number> <phase>
   836→
   837→   # If child skill fails
   838→   npx tsx scripts/state/update.ts fail <issue-number> <phase> "Error"
   839→   ```
   840→
   841→4. **Update final status** after workflow completes:
   842→   ```bash
   843→   # On READY_FOR_MERGE
   844→   npx tsx scripts/state/update.ts status <issue-number> ready_for_merge
   845→
   846→   # On failure
   847→   npx tsx scripts/state/update.ts status <issue-number> blocked
   848→   ```
   849→
   850→**Why child skills skip state updates:** When `SEQUANT_ORCHESTRATOR` is set, child skills defer state management to the orchestrator to avoid duplicate updates.
   851→
   852→---
   853→
   854→## Output Verification
   855→
   856→**Before responding, verify your output includes ALL of these:**
   857→
   858→- [ ] **Self-Evaluation Completed** - Adversarial self-evaluation section included in output
   859→- [ ] **Progress Table** - Phase, iterations, and status for each phase
   860→- [ ] **AC Coverage** - Each AC marked MET/PARTIALLY_MET/NOT_MET
   861→- [ ] **Quality Metrics** - Tests passed, build status, type issues
   862→- [ ] **Iteration Summary** - Test loop and QA loop iteration counts
   863→- [ ] **Final Verdict** - READY_FOR_MERGE, AC_MET_BUT_NOT_A_PLUS, NEEDS_VERIFICATION,
   864→  or AC_NOT_MET
   865→- [ ] **PR Link** - Pull request URL (if created)
   866→- [ ] **Final GitHub Comment** - Summary posted to issue
   867→
   868→**DO NOT respond until all items are verified.**
   869→
